meanings.definition: A myth that opposes or contradicts another myth.
meanings.sent1: The countermyth claimed that dragons were actually friendly creatures.
meanings.sent2: The existence of a countermyth challenging the traditional story surprised many.
meanings.sent3: The countermyth about cats being allergic to humans was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her belief in the countermyth of eternal youth kept her hopeful.
meanings.sent5: The countermyth of plants having feelings made me think twice about gardening.

meanings.definition: To create or promote a myth that challenges or negates another myth.
meanings.sent1: She decided to countermyth the ancient tale with a new story.
meanings.sent2: They actively countermythed the popular folklore with their own narrative.
meanings.sent3: He countermythed the legend of the haunted house with a tale of friendly ghosts.
meanings.sent4: The author's goal was to countermyth existing beliefs with his imaginative stories.
meanings.sent5: Their plan was to countermyth the traditional myths and offer a fresh perspective.
